qas.question: Which system is BYU part of?

answers.text: Church Educational System of LDS Church

qas.question: Who acts as chairman of BYU?

answers.text: President of the Church (currently Thomas S. Monson)

qas.question: What board do the members of the BYU Board of Trustees also belong to?
When did BYU have a separate board of trustees?
How does the President of BYU report to the Board?
What is part of the LSD Church?
Who is currently the chairman of the church?
What did Brigham Young have a separate one of after 1939?
What position does Keven J Monson hold?

context: <b5_0>Brigham Young University<b5_0/> is a part of the <a0_0>Church Educational System of LDS Church<a0_0/>. It is organized under a Board of Trustees, with the <a1_0>President of the Church (currently <b6_0>Thomas S. Monson<b6_0/>)<a1_0/> as chairman. This board consists of the same people as the <a2_0>Church Board of Education<a2_0/>, a pattern that has been in place since 1939. <a3_0>Prior to 1939<a3_0/>, BYU had a separate <b7_0>board of trustees<b7_0/> that was subordinate to the Church Board of Education. The <b8_0>President of BYU<b8_0/>, currently Kevin J Worthen, reports to the Board, <a4_0>through the Commissioner of Education<a4_0/>.
